thread.title: ‘Chappaquiddick’ Review: Tragedy Without Clarity

author: wsjcom
title: ‘Chappaquiddick’ Review: Tragedy Without Clarity
text:
‘Chappaquiddick,” a peculiar amalgam of the known and the unknowable, revisits a pivotal event in American politics that took a young woman’s life and brought the Kennedy era to a shattering end.
It’s the nighttime moment in July 1969, when Sen. Edward Kennedy drove his Oldsmobile sedan off a wooden bridge on Chappaquiddick Island, a tiny speck of land connected to Martha’s Vineyard, and into the dark waters of a tidal pond. He extricated himself but his passenger, a Senate aide named Mary Jo Kopechne, remained trapped in...
